revised_title: Electrical Resistivity of Electrolytic Bismuth in Transverse Magnetic Fields at Various Temperatures
tldr: The authors investigate the electrical resistivity of electrolytic bismuth at low temperatures and in magnetic fields. They find that cooling the bismuth reduces its resistance, and when transversely magnetized, the resistance increases. The resistance curves cross at specific points, depending on the temperature and magnetic field strength, revealing unique behavior of bismuth under these conditions.
